docs.title: Chao Recruit
docs.text: This is a PCB that was designed by Scott-CJX for Nanyang Technological University's (NTU's) Nanyang Venture Formula (NVF) Racing team.

docs.title: Overview
docs.text: The purpose of this board is to be used as a node in part of a larger network that spans NVF-2, NVF's Formula Student Electric Car.

docs.title: Main Features
docs.text:
• ARM processor: STM32F072, running at 48 Mhz
  • USB C Port
  • Wide Range of acceptable Voltage Input: 5V-16V + Fuse
  • Intergrated CAN Bus Interface + Jumper to terminate CAN Bus line
  • 6 Buffered MOSFET Outputs
  • 2 OP-AMP Buffered Analogue Inputs

docs.title: Abstract
docs.text: This board was designed to replace NVF's Small General (SG) PCB. Based on identified the shortcomings of SG, I designed Chao Recruit (CR) PCB to be of the same footprint and yet accomodate for more demanding Input/ Output (IO). The main improvements over SG are the protected inputs (ESD & Overvoltage) and MOSFET driven outputs.

docs.title: Commands
docs.text:
• mkdocs new [dir-name] - Create a new project.
  • mkdocs serve - Start the live-reloading docs server.
  • mkdocs build - Build the documentation site.
  • mkdocs -h - Print help message and exit.

docs.title: Project layout
docs.text:
mkdocs.yml    # The configuration file.
docs/
    index.md  # The documentation homepage.
    ...       # Other markdown pages, images and other files.
